Physics informed simulation & control - Soft Robotics
item.description:
Research Visit at Robust autonomy and decisions lab, IPAB, School of Informatics, University of Edinburgh.

  • Publication: Learning physics-informed simulation models for soft robotic manipulation: A case study with dielectric elastomer actuators

  • Abstract: Soft actuators offer a safe and adaptable approach to robotic tasks like gentle grasping and dexterous movement. Creating accurate models to control such systems however is challenging due to the complex physics of deformable materials. Accurate Finite Element Method (FEM) models incur prohibitive computational complexity for closed-loop use. Using a differentiable simulator is an attractive alternative, but their applicability to soft actuators and deformable materials remains under-explored. This paper presents a framework that combines the advantages of both. We learn a differentiable model consisting of a material properties neural network and an analytical dynamics model of the remainder of the manipulation task. This physics-informed model is trained using data generated from FEM, and can be used for closed-loop control and inference. We evaluate our framework on a dielectric elastomer actuator (DEA) coin-pulling task. We simulate DEA coin pulling in FEM, and design experiments to evaluate the physicsinformed model for simulation, control, and inference. Our model attains ‚â§ 5% simulation error compared to FEM, and we use it as the basis for an MPC controller that outperforms (i.e., requires fewer iterations to converge) a model-free actor-critic policy, a heuristic policy, and a PD controller.

item.title: Rivers
item.description:
Rivers

All flowing
All muddy
All deep
All hollow
All running freely to the ocean under the skies

All rivers
Start the same
Survive the same
End the same
Cliche love stories of
Waterbodies
Meeting
Waterbodies.

Are you ready?

item.title: Summer Ends
item.description:
Summer ends

Sunrays turn incandescent windows
Into yellow iridescent reflections
Of dried up trees outside
I look down at my feet
And the mats are still wet
From soap water I left behind
Before I left.

I’ve come home, two wooden doors
Door bells and windchimes
Leaves leave these days these trees
Before I come back to see
Spring sprouts from siblings running
Behind one another
Chased by
No one,
But me.

Summer ends.
And so does eternity.

item.title: Data Science | Competitions
item.description:
EXL Excellence quotient, 2016

  • National competition | Awarded accuracy champion
  • Organisers - EXL analytics
    • National data analytics competition on revenue modelling for a marketing campaign conducted by EXL analytics with 1000+ teams from IITs. Analysed skewed data of 19 variables and developed insights on spending habits by listing significant variables and their correlations. Achieved 98.9% accuracy of the model by applying polynomial regression (in variables) and linear regression and using CV error (for model selection). Calculated the Impact of offer on the cost and revenue of the bank and concluded an accurate incremental profit of INR 672,948

Young Data scientist, 2017

  • National competition | 143-Leaderboard rank
  • Organisers - ZS associates
    • Prediction of annual revenue and leasing probability for all possible future clients.
    • Prepared leasing conditional probability variables, performed clustering and identified high lease rate hubs based on regions
    • Predicted annual revenue by applying regression on individual hubs using constructed conditional variables (test data- 0.14 error)

item.title: Calculation of Theoretical Performance of Boron-Based Composite Solid Propellant for the Future Applications.
Master Thesis
item.description:
Department of Aerospace Engineering, Indian Institute of Technology, Kharagpur, India.

‚ÄúExperimental screening of boron based solid rocket fuels for hybrid rocket applications‚Äù
Presented also at - 11th International High Energy Material Conference and Exhibits, 2017.

Worked on construction of an opposed flow burner and tested multiple propellant pallet compositions to study Isp and velocity dynamics.

Analysed 120 nano boron compositions, calculated effect of particle size on burn rates, particle trajectory & specific impulse. Used FE SEM and high speed imaging for particle characterisation

item.title: Ramjet Engine Ignition
item.description:
Research Visit at Defence Research and Development Laboratory
Propellant grain igniter testing for ramjet combustion chambers.

  • Supervisor: Mrs Sunita Devi Jena ; Scientist ‚ÄòG‚Äô, DRDO

  • Analysed fuel rich grain based igniter configuration and did its performance evaluation for use in ramjet engine combustion chamber. Devised and tested the magnesium based propellant grain igniter in stand alone/ramjet mode testing. Validated using NASA CEA. Evaluated a new configuration of propellant grain to ensure reliable combustion and prepared chamber pressure - burn time graphs

item.title: Co-Founder | STAC
item.description:
Co-Founder | Space Technology Awareness Camps (STAC), Collaborated with ISRO, India

National initiative for promoting space technology enthusiasm in student community of India through seminars conducted across India. Led a 3 tier team of 15, launched the initiative in 200+ colleges in India and conducted 6 STACs within the 2nd quarter(Sept 2014). Improved the offered value by augmenting with technical (RC plane and Hovercraft) and theoretical (Space talks) sessions in STAC. Focused STAC to acquire funding for CANSAT project undertaken by spAts and currently having total monetary worth of INR 5 Lakh.

item.title: Data Science | Kaggle
item.description:
Bike Sharing

  • Forecast bike rental demand, Kaggle
    • Performed variable manipulation using data visualisation techniques and correlation matrix as preparatory steps for model construction
    • Trained a random forest classifier on the significant parameters & performed hyper-parameter tuning to achieve the error score of 0.4

Titanic

  • Prediction of likelihood of survival of passengers, Kaggle
    • Developed insights on correlations and significant variables for prediction of survival of passengers after preprocessing the training data. Applied regression model and machine learning algorithms (SVM and Random forest) to achieve the maximum accuracy of 78.5

item.title: Bachelors Thesis
item.description:
Department of Aerospace Engineering, Indian Institute of Technology, Kharagpur, India.

Rocket propulsion- ‚ÄúCalculation of Theoretical Performance of Boron-Based Composite Solid Propellant for the Future Applications‚Äù - S.A. Hashim, M. Lahariya, S. Karmakar, A. Roy. Conference : I-DAD in Aerospace and Automotive Engineering, 2016.

Presented insights based on specific impulse and theoretical analysis of performance parameters of metal based solid rocket propellants Analysed 250 propellant configurations and suggested best among those configurations based on high energy density using NASA CEA

item.title: Core Team Head | Publicity & Sponsorship
item.description:
Core Team Head | Publicity & Sponsorship - National Students Space Challenge, Space festival, IIT Kharagpur, India, 2014

Guided a 3 tier team of 50 of the largest national space tech fest with 5000+ footfall, 9 events, 6 workshops(Budget: INR 15 lakh). Acquired sponsorships worth 7 lakh rupees, including the major sponsor Conducted 12 national publicity workshops (Audience: 4000+). Implemented the idea of online registration(and payment) and 3 exhibitions for the first time in NSSC; managed all guest lectures. Structured publicity plans in chronological order for focused marketing resulting in 23% YOY increase in participation from 40+ colleges.
